author: .eagleedge
content: Hello everyone, glad to be here. I will be working on the problems on the ethereum economic model side. Happy to collaborate with anyone who shares the same interest.

author: pavignol
content: Hi everyone! I'm also a permissionless participant with a background in systems programming. I've been running Rocket Pool nodes since the beginning (check them out if you're can, it's an amazing community) but wanted to start contributing on the Ethereum protocol side of things, so here I am!

author: joshd4078
content:
We will be hosting the first meeting Oct 25th.
https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/issues/14

author: erayack
content: Great to see more econ guys

author: ameya
content: Can permissionless fellows update their progress on the Github repo?

author: joshd4078
content: Yes, we encourage anyone participating in the program to use the repo to update your progress.

author: pavignol
content: What would be the main difference between permissionless and permissoned fellows? Is it the mentor support?

author: ameya
content: I think it's mainly the stipend (please correct if wrong)

author: .eagleedge
content: I think another difference might be enhanced support in terms of placement after successfully finishing the program.

author: joshd4078
content: We will do our best to support any participant that is doing good work to continue that work after the program is over.
